body.p: Changes the definition of a data type.

section.title: Synopsis
section.codeblock: ALTER TYPE name OWNER TO new_owner ALTER TYPE name SET SCHEMA new_schema ALTER TYPE name SET DEFAULT ENCODING (storage_directive [,...])

section.title: Description
section.p: ALTER TYPE changes the definition of an existing type. You can change the owner and the schema of a type. You can also add or update storage options for a scalar type.Greenplum Database does not support adding storage options for row or composite types.

You must own the type to use ALTER TYPE. To change the schema of a type, you must also have CREATE privilege on the new schema. To alter the owner, you must also be a direct or indirect member of the new owning role, and that role must have CREATE privilege on the type's schema. (These restrictions enforce that altering the owner does not do anything that could be done by dropping and recreating the type. However, a superuser can alter ownership of any type.)

plentry.pd: The name (optionally schema-qualified) of an existing type to alter.
The user name of the new owner of the type.
The new schema for the type.
Identifies default storage options for the type when specified in a table column definition. Options include COMPRESSTYPE, COMPRESSLEVEL, and BLOCKSIZE.

COMPRESSTYPE — Set to ZLIB (the default), ZSTD, RLE_TYPE, or QUICKLZ1 to specify the type of compression used.1QuickLZ compression is available only in the commercial release of Pivotal Greenplum Database.

COMPRESSLEVEL — For Zstd compression, set to an integer value from 1 (fastest compression) to 19 (highest compression ratio). For zlib compression, the valid range is from 1 to 9. The QuickLZ compression level can only be set to 1. For RLE_TYPE, the compression level can be set to an integer value from 1 (fastest compression) to 4 (highest compression ratio). The default compression level is 1.

BLOCKSIZE — Set to the size, in bytes, for each block in the column. The BLOCKSIZE must be between 8192 and 2097152 bytes, and be a multiple of 8192. The default block size is 32768.storage_directives defined at the table- or column- level override the default storage options defined for a type.

section.title: Examples
section.p: To change the owner of the user-defined type email to joe:
section.codeblock: ALTER TYPE email OWNER TO joe;
section.p: To change the schema of the user-defined type email to customers:
section.codeblock: ALTER TYPE email SET SCHEMA customers;
section.p: To set or alter the compression type and compression level of the user-defined type named int33:
section.codeblock: ALTER TYPE int33 SET DEFAULT ENCODING (compresstype=zlib, compresslevel=7);

section.title: Compatibility
section.p: There is no ALTER TYPE statement in the SQL standard.
